content:
An additional issue is found while I'm trying to solve this puzzle, regarding the pair of cases "Only known HTML entities".

The input string of the validator contains "€" which is translated to "€". Two issues:

(1) &#nnnn; is not covered in any visible test. (note)

(2) Even if you add one in a visible test, the issue will be that the CodinGame console doesn't handle non-ASCII characters and won't display them properly.

To solve the above issues, please:

(1) For the test, please include "&#nnn;" (that's a 3-digit ASCII code in the range of 100 to 126) which will be converted to an ASCII character.

(2) For the validator, please change "€" to "&#nnn;" (that's also a 3-digit ASCII code in the range of 100 to 126).

Note: I understand that Goal section has mentioned that "nn" may consist of any number of digits, but it's still not very nice to cover a code of >2 digits in a validator only.

Thanks.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: seems good to me

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This contribution helped me learn about how Go handles complex runes in a string.

I think the entity decoding like "+" => "+" 
uses "decimal digit" and not "hexadecimal digit".

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Quite interesting and well covered by tests.

Cover picture
* Suggest to upload a cover picture for the puzzle.

Thanks.

This is a puzzle adapted from a rejected CoC challenge I made: https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/86310a10cb200b0aea0620f39e0915ceb4f07

I turned it into a puzzle based on the following feedback:

* "It is too hard for a clash. May i recommend making it a puzzle instead?"
* "I can't imagine most people being able to finish within the 15 minute limit, let alone within the desired 5 minutes. I would make a good puzzle, though."
* "Quite complicated to finish it in the given mean time"
* "This puzzle looks fantastic, but most certainly not solvable in 15 minutes"
Ah, thanks, I actually forgot about that. Done!
You're absolutely right! Thanks for the correction :-)

I see your point, and went for a simpler approach: I added <<or "Apple™">> / <<or "Apple™">> in the test. Does that answer the need? :-)

(I also added ", &nnn;, &nnnn;, etc" to be extra clear)

I don't seem to be able to reproduce the case, whether it is with a program of mine or with yours (obtained through https://www.codingame.com/training/easy/escape-the-madness/solution). I've fiddled a bit with the test to see if I could get rid of some whitespace if there is any, can you try again and check if you still have the issue?

Ah, it's working now...

If I change :
char text[501]="More M\\??/u004DNESS!";

back to :
char text[501];

It now passes.  Earlier, it was always hanging on that one validator.  As though the scanf was failing and nothing was being read (for that one validator)

How odd.  Oh well, thanks Cake!

Puzzle upvoted!
No, please avoid using &#nnnn; until CodinGame has fixed the issue of displaying non-ASCII characters in the console.
In short, please stay within the ASCII code range between 100 and 126 for the revisions.
Was waiting for the puzzle to update, but should be good, used lowercase letters :-)
All right, it looks good now! Thanks.
